member.name: F:SMT.THX.MediaDirector.Formats.Bluray.Shared.IO.Binary.BaseElements.cMD_EL_SHR_MetadataModifierRecord_Video.ModifierMask
member.summary: Video Modifier Mask is a 32-bit mask. Each bit represents a Media Director Content Descriptor. A value of one (1b) indicates that the corresponding descriptor is present. The bit mask also defines the structure of its Modifier Data, as the Modifier Data only contains the values of those descriptors with bits that have a value of 1b.

member.name: F:SMT.THX.MediaDirector.Formats.Bluray.Shared.IO.Binary.BaseElements.cMD_EL_SHR_MetadataModifierRecord_Video.ModifierData
member.summary:
Section 4.6.2.2 Spec Version 0.8.2
The structure of the Video Modifier Data depends on its Video Modifier Mask, including the length, the order and the data counts. The corresponding Content Descriptor of the first bit with value 1 in the mask indicates the starting point of the Video Modifier Data, followed by the next Content Description with a bit value 1 in the mask, and so on. The length of Video Modifier Data is the total length of all Content Descriptors with value 1 in the mask.

member.name: M:SMT.THX.MediaDirector.Formats.Bluray.Shared.IO.Binary.BaseElements.cMD_EL_SHR_MetadataModifierRecord_Video.#ctor(System.IO.Stream@)
member.summary: This constructor is used to instantiate this object usually from a FileStream. Note: The stream must be queued to the start byte of this structure before calling the constructor.

member.name: T:SMT.THX.MediaDirector.Formats.Bluray.Shared.IO.Binary.BaseElements.cMD_EL_SHR_MetadataModifierRecord_Video
member.summary:
Section 4.6.2 Spec version 0.8.2
Each Metadata Modifier record consists of two sections: Modifier Mask and Modifier Data. The Modifier Mask specifies which Media Director Content Descriptors are present, while the Modifier Data details the values of those descriptors.

member.summary: Audio Modifier Mask is a 32-bit mask. Each bit represents a Media Director Content Descriptor. A value of one (1b) indicates that the corresponding descriptor is present. The bit mask also defines the structure of its Modifier Data, as the Modifier Data only contains the values of those descriptors with bits that have a value of 1b.

member.name: F:SMT.THX.MediaDirector.Formats.Bluray.Shared.IO.Binary.BaseElements.cMD_EL_SHR_MetadataModifierRecord_Audio.ModifierData
member.summary:
Section 4.6.2.2 Spec Version 0.8.2
The structure of the Audio Modifier Data depends on its Audio Modifier Mask, including the length, the order and the data counts. The corresponding Content Descriptor of the first bit with value 1 in the mask indicates the starting point of the Audio Modifier Data, followed by the next Content Description with a bit value 1 in the mask, and so on. The length of Audio Modifier Data is the total length of all Content Descriptors with value 1 in the mask.
